prompt:
Nurse: I'm glad to hear that, Mr. Koroleva. How has your day been so far?

Patient: It's been really good. Thank you

Nurse: That's wonderful to hear, Mr. Koroleva.

Patient: so much.

Nurse: That's wonderful to hear, Mr. Koroleva. I'm glad you're having a good day.

Patient: But I'm just seeing now I'm just feeling a a a little anxious. And if you find me being in pace and that's just how I am. Don't get it. Don't take it personally.

Nurse: Of course, Mr. Koroleva. It's completely normal to feel a bit anxious before a procedure. I'm here to help you with any questions or concerns you might have. How are you feeling about your upcoming colonoscopy?

Patient: Gosh. I just you know, I I I just wanna get it done and forget about it. I, you know, I'm I'm having kinda, like, nightmares about it. You know, I read a lot. There's so much information online, and it's all it's all kinda, like, really devastating.

responses.gpt4: I truly appreciate your honesty, Mr. Koroleva. It's entirely natural to feel apprehensive when reading diverse information online. This is where I can assist you by providing guidance from reliable sources and addressing any uncertainties you may have. Do you want to discuss some of the information you've come across, or any questions we could work through together before we continue? Please feel free to ask me questions at any point during our conversation.
responses.our_model: I can imagine that it's a lot to take in, Mr. Koroleva. It's completely normal to feel this way. I see on your chart that you're getting this colonoscopy due to the presence of pus and mucus in your stool. It can indeed be quite a process to go through this procedure. How are you feeling about it?
